title: Constructible topology
summary: In commutative algebra, the constructible topology on the spectrum Spec ⁡ ( A ) {\displaystyle \operatorname {Spec} (A)} of a commutative ring A {\displaystyle A} is a topology where each closed set is the image of Spec ⁡ ( B ) {\displaystyle \operatorname {Spec} (B)} in Spec ⁡ ( A ) {\displaystyle \operatorname {Spec} (A)} for some algebra B over A. An important feature of this construction is that the map Spec ⁡ ( B ) → Spec ⁡ ( A ) {\displaystyle \operatorname {Spec} (B)\to \operatorname {Spec} (A)} is a closed map with respect to the constructible topology.
